Rs 22,000 crore scholarship scam unearthed in Union minority ministry, CBI takes over probe

Through fake institutions and fake students, the Ministry of Minority Affairs' scholarship fraud resulted in a loss of millions of rupees reserved for the scholarships of students from minority communities.

New Delhi: In a major scholarship scam of Rs 22000 crore across India, the Minority Affairs Ministry has handed over the investigation of the case to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to investigate the irregularities in the funds.

According to TV9 Bharatvarsh, the case is worth crores of rupees through fake institutions and fake students.

Through fake institutions and fake students, the Ministry of Minority Affairs' scholarship fraud resulted in a loss of millions of rupees reserved for the scholarships of students from minority communities.

According to reports, 22000 crore of rupees have been misappropriated in the fraud. The anomalies came to light after the scholarship applications were verified.

During the investigation of the irregularities in the scholarships, it was found that 53 of the 21,1572 minority institutions, inspected by the Ministry of Minority Affairs, in 830 states.

Additionally, five per cent of the institutions were discovered to be false or inactive throughout the inquiry. The National Council of Applied Economic Research (NCAER) was commissioned by the ministry to look into it.

According to the investigation, frauds totalling Rs. 830.144 crore were found in just 83 institutions over the course of the past five years.

Investigations found that Rs. 144.83 crore was illegally withdrawn in the names of fake institutions and that scholarships were being fraudulently transferred to fake accounts and students.

Investigators were shocked to see 22 children enrolled on one mobile number for the scholarship.

Earlier this month, Minority Affairs Minister Smriti Irani informed Parliament that the Union Ministry of Minority Affairs has started the process of re-verifying institutions and recipients of various scholarships for minority students after discrepancies were discovered during the verification of these scholarships' applications.

Irani had said that once "irregularities" were discovered, the Centre charged the NCAER with "monitoring and evaluating the Central Government Minority Scholarship Scheme."

vclaim: A Rs 22,000 crore scholarship scam has been uncovered in India's Ministry of Minority Affairs and is now being investigated by the CBI. The scam involved fake institutions and students fraudulently obtaining scholarships meant for minority communities. Out of 211,572 minority institutions inspected across states, 53 institutions were found to be involved in fraudulent activities. Investigation revealed that Rs 830.144 crore worth of fraud was discovered in 83 institutions over five years. Rs 144.83 crore was illegally withdrawn through fake institutions and fraudulent transfers to fake accounts and students. The Ministry has initiated a re-verification process of institutions and scholarship recipients after discovering irregularities.
